newsitem.title: FINLAND: RAUMA TO BUY SWEDISH GRINDING OPERATION.
newsitem.headline: RAUMA TO BUY SWEDISH GRINDING OPERATION.

text.p: Finnish engineering group Rauma Oy said on Monday its crushing equipment division Nordberg would merge its grinding mill unit with that of Swedish Morgardshammar and buy the new venture in two and a half years.
Initially the two would set a joint venture merging their grinding mill businesses, Rauma said in a statement.
"Nordberg will own 60 percent of the company and acquire the remaining 40 percent within two and a half years," Rauma said.
The combined net sales of the two companies' grinding mill businesses is 170 million markka and the new company will have 40 employees, it said.
"The agreement will considerably strengthen Nordberg Group's position as a supplier of complete grinding and crushing processes for the mining industry," it said.
Morgardshammar is part of Italian Danieli which is one of the leading suppliers of equipment to the steel industry, Rauma said.
